EXTRACTED VALUE: Kendrick Perkins (knee) said he is targeting early February for his return.
Keyon Dooling had 18 points and five assists off the Bucks bench on Wednesday in 25 minutes.
Jeff Teague is officially splitting backup PG duties with rookie Jordan Crawford, based upon matchups.
Luke Harangody had 16 points, 12 rebounds and hit two 3-pointers on 4-of-9 shooting in Wednesday's win over the Knicks.
Andris Biedrins returned from an upset stomach on Sunday, finishing with four points and six rebounds in 23 foul-plagued minutes.
Delonte West (wrist) said his cast will be removed in two weeks and he expects to return during the regular season.
The Bulls signed point guard John Lucas on Friday.
Josh Howard (knee surgery) says he could make his season debut next week.
The MRI taken on Chris Kaman's injured left ankle showed a bone bruise, and he will not play in Wednesday's game and possibly more.
Bucks will waive second-round rookie F Darington Hobson, sources tell Hoopsworld's Alex Kennedy.
Carlos Delfino (concussion symptoms) admitted that he is still experiencing headaches.
A.J. Price made his season-debut on Tuesday, scoring seven points on 2-of-3 shooting with no rebounds and two assists in 11 minutes.
Wizards rookie Kevin Seraphin recently received his work visa and arrived in Washington on Saturday.
Nuggets forward Renaldo Balkman hasn't been giving it his all at practice, according to beat writer Benjamin Hochman.
The NBA announced on Monday that it has purchased the Hornets from George Shinn.
Andrew Bynum (knee) is now targeting Tuesday's game against the Wizards for his return, according to ESPN.com.
Leon Powe scored 10 points on 5-of-9 shooting with six rebounds, no assists, and no steals or blocks in a start at small forward on Saturday.
DeSagana Diop had four points, four rebounds, a block and a steal in 20 minutes Wednesday and coach Larry Brown liked what he saw.
LeBron James said on Saturday that Mike Miller is one or two weeks away from returning from his thumb injury.
Chris Andersen has a small fracture in his lower vertebrae, and Nuggets coach George Karl believes he will miss about two weeks.
Jonas Jerebko shed his walking boot on Friday and may be ahead of schedule to return from his partially ruptured Achilles' tendon.
Eddy Curry got another DNP on Friday, but is supposedly healthy enough to play.
Raymond Felton hit a career-high five 3-pointers on Monday, and scored 18 points on 6-of-13 shooting with three rebounds, 11 assists, and four steals.
Jared Jeffries had 12 points and eight rebounds on 6-of-9 shooting in Wednesday's exhibition game in China.
Josh Childress (finger) will still have to wear a splint on his right (shooting) hand for two more weeks.
Kelenna Azubuike (knee surgery) could make his season debut as soon as next week.
Jason Kapono returned to 76ers practice on Monday after spending some time away for personal reasons.
Sasha Vujacic made his Lakers debut on Sunday and had three points in eight minutes.
Kurt Thomas scored 10 points on 5-of-6 shooting with eight rebounds and no assists in 28 minutes off the bench.
D.J. Augustin played through a sinus infection on Wednesday and had 13 points, six assists and a 3-pointer in the loss.
David West returned from the flu with 13 points and five rebounds in 30 minutes, but the Hornets were crushed in San Antonio.
Malik Allen has made the Magic's roster and will be the team's third center.
An MRI on Daniel Orton's injured left knee revealed no major or structural damage.
Robin Lopez (knee) could return to full team practices as soon as next week.
Manny Harris tweeted Thursday that he made the Cavs' roster, which means that Danny Green will likely be cut.
Joel Anthony started and logged 24 minutes on Sunday, collecting one point, three rebounds, four blocks and a steal.
Jazz C Kyrylo Fesenko (sprained ankle) will not practice Tuesday and is in a boot.
The quad injury that caused Tyrus Thomas to leave late during Tuesday's game is not serious, according to the Charlotte Observer.
Ray Allen scored 35 points with seven threes on 13-of-23 shooting in Thursday's 112-107 win over the Heat.
DeMarcus Cousins scored 15 points on 6-of-15 shooting with seven rebounds, three assists, one steal, and one block in 29 minutes of action on Monday.
Ryan Anderson (mid-foot sprain) came down with a stomach virus and hasn't been able to get X-rays on his foot.
Ed Davis played 17 minutes off the bench on Sunday and collected six points, eight rebounds, one steal and one turnover.
Coach Phil Jackson does not like having to play raw rookie Derrick Caracter extended minutes as Pau Gasol's backup.
Joe Johnson had surgery on his right elbow on Thursday -- he will begin his rehab on Friday but isn't expected to play for four-to-six weeks.
Charlie Villanueva, who will miss Tuesday's game for personal reasons, is expected back for Wednesday's game at New Orleans.
Darko Milicic is day-to-day with a quad contusion after an update to his status Tuesday night.
As expected, the Heat have assigned rookie Dexter Pittman to the D-League.
Swingman Julian Wright was traded from the Hornets to the Raptors on Wednesday.
Maurice Evans went back to the bench for Monday's game, playing just 10 minutes without scoring with just one rebound to his credit.
Jermaine O'Neal is back with the Celtics and working out, but could still be two weeks away from returning.
Coach Avery Johnson hinted that rookie Derrick Favors may join the starting lineup at some point soon.
The Pacers have no plans to send second round G Lance Stephenson to the NBADL.
Thunder PF/C Nick Collison did not play on Sunday because of poor matchups.
Carmelo Anthony admitted Tuesday night that he is still feeling the effects of that cold.
Jonny Flynn (hip) will return to the NBADL for two more games this weekend.
Haws G Pape Sy (back) worked out on the court Monday for the first time since the start of camp.
Even Turner went scoreless on Saturday against the Bobcats, going 0-for-1 from the field with two rebounds and one assist in 11 minutes off the bench.
Yao Ming (ankle/leg) will not practice this week.
Reggie Evans is expected to be sidelined for approximately eight weeks after having surgery on his fractured foot.
The Spurs have signed free agent F Ime Udoka.
Taj Gibson played through foot pain on Wednesday, finishing with 10 points and four rebounds.
Tony Allen has fallen out of the Grizzlies' rotation.
Coach Avery Johnson confirmed that Joe Smith will start at power forward in Wednesday's season opener.
Kenyon Martin (knee) received encouraging news on Monday -- the atrophy is nearly gone from his leg and he hopes to return in a matter of weeks.
Chris Wilcox made his season debut for the Pistons on Wednesday and had four points in three minutes.
Luol Deng, who came in hot, had just eight points and four rebounds on 2-of-6 shooting in Wednesday's loss to the Magic.
Greg Oden (knee surgery) is targeting next season's training camp for his return.
Charlie Bell has been traded to the Warriors, along with Dan Gadzuric, in exchange for Corey Maggette.
Veteran center Brian Skinner signed with the Bucks on Thursday.
Shaquille Oï¿½Neal is experiencing the same knee soreness that caused him to miss five games last month, though he's gamely playing through the pain.
Rajon Rondo admitted that he is most concerned with his strained hamstring.
Dominic McGuire started for Charlotte on Wednesday in the absence of Stephen Jackson, who was sitting out a one-game suspension.
Dirk Nowitzki had just 10 points, one rebound and one assist on 4-of-11 shooting in Wednesday's win over the Timberwolves.
Aaron Brooks (ankle) admitted that he still hasn't been cleared to practice.
The Suns are not expected to pick up Earl Clark's extension.
Jeremy Evans had five points in six minutes in his return from a wrist injury.
Roddy Beaubois (foot) has not even been cleared to do any running or jumping yet.
Russell Westbrook hit 14-of-32 shots for 38 points, 15 rebounds, nine assists and three steals in Wednesday's triple-overtime win over the Nets.
The Bucks signed point guard Earl Boykins to a one-year, $1.3 million deal on Thursday.
Mavs officially announced the signings of Dee Brown, Brian Cardinal and Adam Haluska on Monday.
Pistons G Terrico White (foot) expects to return sometime in December.
Cavs sent F Christian Eyenga to the Erie Bayhawks of the NBADL.
Celtics rookie Semih Erden is playing with an injured shoulder that coach Doc Rivers acknowledged is waiting to pop out of the socket.
Eduardo Najera (groin) returned to action from a groin injury when he played for one second on Saturday night.
Trail Blazers rookie Elliot Williams will undergo surgery to repair a dislocated right patella. He is expected to miss the rest of the 2010-11 season.
The Raptors assigned rookie center Solomon Alabi to the D-League.
Anthony Tolliver's MRI revealed a sprained right MCL, and he is expected to miss 6-8 weeks.
Hilton Armstrong returned from a one-game suspension on Friday and had six points and three rebounds in 12 minutes.
Josh Powell came off the bench for the Hawks and hit 8-of-9 shots for 16 points in a win over the Grizzlies.
Eddie House was furious at Daniel Gibson both during and following Thursday's game, and had to be talked out of a physical confrontation.
Tyson Chandler (flu) will not play on Tuesday against the Warriors, and Brendan Haywood will start in his place.
Peja Stojakovic is not traveling with the Raptors due to his knee injury and will miss his fourth straight game on Monday.
Gerald Henderson (knee) hopes to resume on-court activity in a week.
Baron Davis (hamstring) will be a game-time decision for Wednesday's game against the Lakers, based on how he feels after the team's shootaround.
Tony Parker says that he has rediscovered the aggressiveness that propelled him to new heights in the first 14 games of the season.
Nets recalled Terrence Williams from the Springfield Armor of the NBADL.
The Wolves have signed free agent guard Sundiata Gaines.
The Nuggets have officially re-signed 12-year NBA veteran Anthony Carter.
The Hawks signed free agent center Etan Thomas, who played for the Thunder last season.
Warriors rookie Ekpe Udoh (wrist) has begun practicing and seems likely to return before his original timetable of mid-January.
Tim Duncan had 22 points, 10 rebounds, five assists, three steals and four blocks on 9-of-14 shooting in Friday's win over the Wolves.
Dante Cunningham played 19 minutes off the bench on Thursday, recording just one point, two rebounds and one assist.
Hornets center D.J. Mbenga stayed in New Orleans on Sunday, battling the same illness that had sidelined David West.
Cavaliers rookie Samardo Samuels missed the end of Tuesday's practice because of cramping. He was given fluids and will be fine.
Veteran center Jamaal Magloire has officially signed a one-year contract to remain with the Heat next season. He will earn the veteran's minimum.
Coach Jerry Sloan declined to say if Mehmet Okur (Achilles) will start or come off the bench upon his return.
Eric Maynor hit 4-of-6 shots for 10 points and two steals in Wednesday's preseason game.
Darrell Arthur came back from a knee injury and had seven points and four rebounds in 19 minutes on Friday.
Martell Webster has been cleared by doctors to return to action for the Wolves.
Darius Songaila has reportedly been traded to the Sixers from the Hornets.
Jason Collins started at center on Tuesday against Brook Lopez and the Nets, with Marvin Williams getting the start at shooting guard.
Bill Walker (knee) will not play in Monday's game against the Wolves.
Udonis Haslem (foot surgery) said he is targeting April for his return.
The Thunder recalled rookie Cole Aldrich from the D-League on Monday.
The Nets have signed G/F Stephen Graham to a two-year deal.
Byron Scott is reportedly thinking about changing the starting lineup for the Cavaliers, but gave no hints as to what he might do.
Eric Bledsoe scored 15 points on 4-of-12 shooting (including two threes) with three rebounds, three assists, and a steal on Monday.
Andy Rautins (knee bruise) is expected to be ready for training camp.
Joey Dorsey started and played 19 minutes on Sunday, scoring nine points on 4-of-6 shooting with six rebounds and two assists.
Michael Redd (knee) is still targeting a return in February.
Jon Brockman returned from an ankle injury and scored two points on Friday.
Ron Artest blamed his declining numbers on the improved play of his teammates.
Spurs rookie James Anderson has a stress fracture in his right foot and is expected to miss about eight weeks.
